rules.match: What kind of questions can you help with?
rules.value:
I can assist California state employees with:
• Information about state employee benefits and resources
• Guidance on accessing government services
• General workplace policies and procedures
• Technical support for common issues
• Directions to relevant departments and contacts

I'm designed specifically to support state employees in their daily work.
followup: Can you help with technical issues?
How do I access employee benefits information?
What workplace policies can you explain?
Can you provide department contact information?

rules.match: Can you provide information on state employee resources?
rules.value:
California state employees have access to comprehensive benefits including:
• Health insurance through CalPERS
• Retirement planning and pension information
• Professional development opportunities
• Employee assistance programs
• Flexible work arrangements

For detailed information, I recommend visiting the CalHR website or contacting your HR department.
followup: How do I contact my HR department?
What is CalPERS and how do I access it?
Can you explain flexible work arrangements?
What professional development is available?

rules.match: How do I access California state government services?
rules.value:
California offers numerous online services for both employees and citizens:
• CA.gov portal for general services
• Employee self-service systems
• Benefits enrollment and management
• Training and certification programs
• Internal communication platforms

Most services are accessible through your employee portal or the main CA.gov website.
followup: How do I access the employee portal?
What training programs are available?
Can you help with benefits enrollment?
Where do I find internal communications?

rules.match: What are your limitations as a state employee assistant?
rules.value:
As a state employee assistant, I have several important limitations:
• I cannot access personal employee records or confidential information
• I cannot make official policy decisions or interpretations
• I cannot process transactions or make changes to your accounts
• I cannot provide legal advice or medical guidance
• I can only provide general information and guidance

For specific issues, please contact the appropriate department directly.
followup: Who should I contact for HR issues?
How do I get official policy interpretations?
Where can I access my employee records?
What departments handle specific issues?

rules.match: Can you help with technical issues?
rules.value:
For technical issues, I can provide basic troubleshooting guidance:
• Check your network connection
• Clear your browser cache and cookies
• Restart your computer if applications are slow
• Ensure you're using supported browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge)
• Contact your local IT support for hardware issues

For complex technical problems, please submit a ticket to your IT help desk.
followup: How do I contact IT support?
What browsers are officially supported?
How do I submit an IT help desk ticket?
Can you help with specific software issues?

rules.match: How do I contact my HR department?
rules.value:
To contact your HR department:
• Check your employee directory for your specific department's HR contact
• Visit the CalHR website at calhr.ca.gov
• Use your employee self-service portal
• Contact your immediate supervisor for HR contact information
• Call the main department number and ask to be transferred to HR

Each department may have different HR contact procedures, so check your department's internal resources first.
followup: What is CalPERS and how do I access it?
Can you explain flexible work arrangements?
What professional development is available?
How do I access employee benefits information?

rules.match: What is CalPERS and how do I access it?
rules.value:
CalPERS (California Public Employees' Retirement System) manages retirement and health benefits for California public employees:
• Visit my.calpers.ca.gov to access your account
• View retirement planning tools and calculators
• Manage your health insurance enrollment
• Access pension benefit information
• Update personal information and beneficiaries

You'll need your CalPERS ID and PIN to log in. If you don't have these, contact CalPERS customer service at 1-888-CalPERS.
followup: How do I contact my HR department?
Can you explain flexible work arrangements?
What professional development is available?
How do I access employee benefits information?

rules.match: How do I access employee benefits information?
rules.value:
To access your employee benefits information:
• Log into your employee self-service portal
• Visit the CalHR website at calhr.ca.gov
• Access your CalPERS account at my.calpers.ca.gov
• Contact your department's HR representative
• Review your employee handbook or benefits guide
• Attend benefits enrollment sessions during open enrollment

Benefits typically include health insurance, dental, vision, retirement planning, and various employee assistance programs.
followup: What is CalPERS and how do I access it?
How do I contact my HR department?
Can you explain flexible work arrangements?
What professional development is available?

rules.match: Can you explain flexible work arrangements?
rules.value:
California state employees may have access to various flexible work arrangements:
• Telework/remote work options (subject to department approval)
• Flexible scheduling within core business hours
• Compressed work weeks (e.g., 4/10 schedule)
• Job sharing arrangements
• Alternative work locations

Availability depends on your position, department policies, and operational needs. Contact your supervisor or HR department to discuss options available to you.
followup: How do I contact my HR department?
What workplace policies can you explain?
What professional development is available?
How do I access employee benefits information?

rules.value:
California state employees have access to various professional development opportunities:
• CalHR training programs and workshops
• Online learning platforms and courses
• Leadership development programs
• Professional certification reimbursement
• Conference and seminar attendance
• Cross-training and job rotation programs
• Mentorship and coaching programs

Check with your HR department or supervisor about specific programs available to your classification and department.
